page.title: 02PARISH OF BUDBROOKE-CHANGES.
page.content: Changes in last 2O years. Royal Warwickshire Regimental Barracks dismantled. Hampton Magna, a village of 6OO houses built with a school, pub and, with help of public,a community centre.Many young couples so large rise in local birth rate with about 8 sets of twins. Hampton Croft,a small council estate built at Hampton on the Hill as were 3 houses on site of old school and 13 large bungalows.On Budbrooke Road a Weights and Measures building with weighbridge was erected. Lately a large sewage disposal pipe- line from Hatton to Warwick has been constructed picking up sewage from the parish. The A46 Warwick By-pass was built on the edge of the parish linking the Banbury Road to Coventry. St Michaels Church graveyard became full. All elm trees destroyed by disease.Some farm hedges grubbed out
